title: Queer Eye's Antoni Porowski reveals he became insecure about his body after he began dating men
text:
Queer Eye's Antoni Porowski says that he's been more self-conscious about his physique since he began dating men.

The 35-year-old wine curator, speaking with Glamour UK, said he was 'most comfortable' with his body image when he 'was in relationships with women, because there wasn't a sense of comparison,' as they 'were different' physically.

'It was my first relationship with a guy where I kind of looked at myself, and I was like, "Oh, my biceps aren't as big as his," or "My legs are longer, I wish my torso were longer,"' said the Montreal native, who spoke with the outlet to promote his cookbook Antoni in The Kitchen.

Introspective: Queer Eye's Antoni Porowski, 35, says that he's been more self-conscious about his physique since he began dating men

Porowski said that he's very hard on himself about his body, though he believes people 'shouldn’t have to' be.

'Women and men have all kinds of societal pressures,' said Porowski, who's a pal of pop superstar Taylor Swift. 'Sometimes they’re self-imposed and the idea of perfection - whatever the hell that is!'

He stressed self-acceptance as a key trait for people, saying, 'If you’re not practicing self-acceptance, you don’t really know who you are.

'If you know who you are, that should be good enough. Lean into things you’re passionate about.'

On the promotional trail: The Montreal native spoke with the outlet to promote his cookbook Antoni in The Kitchen

Insight: The reality star said he was 'most comfortable' with his body when he 'was in relationships with women, because there wasn't a sense of comparison' as they 'were different' physically

Porowski opened up on modifications to his diet as an on-camera personality.

'Since the show came out, I have seriously cut down on dairy,' Porowski said. 'That’s changed my body a lot. I’m somebody who loves cheese but also when you’re on camera all the time, you see yourself at an angle and you can drive yourself crazy sometimes.'

Porowski said that he has the usual course of ups and down in maintaining his diet and exercise routine.

'I have days when I wake up, feel like human garbage and eat plant based and go to the gym twice a day and then I have days where I feel really good about myself and destroy two burgers in a day with a pizza and a milkshake and maybe have a chocolate bar,' he said. 'I have two sides of me and that goes with anything.'

Porowski appears on Queer Eye alongside culture and lifestyle specialist Karamo Brown, designer Bobby Berk, fashion stylist Tan France and grooming expert Jonathan Van Ness.
